result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Jo Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today May 13, 2016.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF266.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF266.

-Defendant not to commit any crimes.
-Defendant to report to the St. Croix County Jail today May 13, 2016 to provide a DNA sample.
-Pay Supervision fees.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Amanda Jo Brown appeared.  Court called.  There is an agreement.  State moves to amend to misdemeanor theft 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a).  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1.  Crt reviews the police reports.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Victim rights have been complied with.  Crt orders:

Amended Ct. 1
- S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- DE's probation can be transferred to Minnesota
- DE not to commit any crimes
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through the DOC
- DE to report to the St. Croix County jail today 05/13/16 to provide a DNA sample
- DE to report to probation today 05/13/16
- DE's bail to remain in effect until she has signed up for probation and then it is vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

DE needs time to pay the $150.00 transfer fees.  Comntinue the Plea/Sentencing.  Verified the DE's address.  Bail is continued. Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Barbara N. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
